dish_description: New England clam chowder is a creamy soup that typically includes clams, potatoes, onions or leeks, and bacon or salt pork. It is known for its rich texture and comforting flavors.

cooking_steps.description: Fry the bacon with a little bit of olive oil in a pot for 3 to 4 minutes.

Prepare the leek by cutting it in half to expose the center, wash it thoroughly to remove any dirt, and then chop it to yield about 2 cups. If leeks are not available, onions can be used as a substitute.
Add the chopped leek to the pot with the bacon and cook for a minute.
Crush and finely chop a large clove of garlic to yield about 2 teaspoons and add it to the pot with the leek and bacon.
Add a teaspoon of fresh thyme and 2 to 3 tablespoons of chopped jalapeno pepper to the pot, adjusting the quantity based on the desired level of spiciness.
Pour in 2 cups of clam juice and about a cup of water to the pot.
Dice half a pound of potatoes into 1 12 inch cubes and add them to the pot, ensuring the amount is roughly equal to the amount of leek used.
Season the mixture with about 1 12 teaspoon of salt and freshly ground pepper to taste.
If the flour was not added earlier, dilute a couple of tablespoons of flour in a bit of the stock and add it to the pot to thicken the chowder.
Bring the pot to a gentle boil and let it cook for about 20 minutes.
Cut fresh corn off the cob to yield about a cup and add it to the pot towards the end of the cooking time, cooking it for just about 1 minute.
Add 2 cans of 10-ounce baby clams to the pot and bring it back to a boil.
Finish the chowder with a good half a cup of heavy cream, bringing it to a final boil.
Garnish the New England clam chowder with chopped chives for color and serve hot.
